Name: yarn

Arguments.Name: --flat
Arguments.Description: Only allow one version of a package

Arguments.Name: --focus
Arguments.Description: Focus on a single workspace by installing remote copies of its sibling workspaces

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Install and build packages even if they were built before, overwrite lockfile

Arguments.Description: Don't generate a lockfile and fail if an update is needed

Arguments.Name: --global-folder
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom folder to store global packages

Arguments.Name: --har
Arguments.Description: Save HAR output of network traffic

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Format Yarn log messages as lines of JSON (see jsonlines.org)

Arguments.Name: --link-duplicates
Arguments.Description: Create hardlinks to the repeated modules in node_modules

Arguments.Name: --link-folder
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom folder to store global links

Arguments.Name: --modules-folder
Arguments.Description: Rather than installing modules into the node_modules folder relative to the cwd, output them here

Arguments.Name: --mutex
Arguments.Description: Use a mutex to ensure only one yarn instance is executing

Arguments.Name: --network-concurrency
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of concurrent network requests

Arguments.Description: Don't generate bin links when setting up packages

CustomArgumentTemplates.Name: CustomArgument
CustomArgumentTemplates.Command: bash -c until [[ -f package.json ]] || [[ $PWD = '/' ]]; do cd ..; done; cat package.json
